message.content:
{"id": "13196", "title": "Bug 13196 - Unexpected behavioral difference when manipulating source in Java Browsing Perspective", "description": "When performing certain actions in the Java Browsing Perspective, there is an unexpected behavioral difference. This occurs when manipulating source in the type hierarchy and in the method list. 

Steps to reproduce:
1) Open Java Browsing Perspective
2) Select a type
3) Select a method in the method list view
4) Delete the method (context menu of the method list view)
   - The editor becomes dirty (expected behavior)
5) Select another type
6) Open type hierarchy on this type and dock the hierarchy view
7) Select a method in the method list view
8) Select the same method in the hierarchy view
9) Delete the method (context menu of the hierarchy view)
   - The method is deleted on the file system
   - The type list view, method list view, and editor are all cleared

Note: This issue does not occur when the editor is already dirty.", "OB": "When deleting a method in the hierarchy view, the method is deleted on the file system and all relevant views (type list view, method list view, editor) are cleared.", "EB": "", "SR": ""}

", 'EB': '', 'SR': ''}
